description.raw:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.


## Requirements:
* ~~libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)~~
* libsdformat9 PRs [PR 640](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/640) and [PR 647](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647)

## TODO:
* ~~Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.~~
* ~~Add frame semantics for model editor ~~
* ~~Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. ~~

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
description.html:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in SDFormat PR 560. It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

Requirements:

  • libsdformat7 PR 560
  • libsdformat9 PRs PR 640 and PR 647

TODO:

  • Add support for joint axis expressed_in attribute.
  • Add frame semantics for model editor
  • Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping frames and relative_tos intact.

cc: @Eric Cousineau

summary.html:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in SDFormat PR 560. It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

Requirements:

  • libsdformat7 PR 560
  • libsdformat9 PRs PR 640 and PR 647

TODO:

  • Add support for joint axis expressed_in attribute.
  • Add frame semantics for model editor
  • Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping frames and relative_tos intact.

cc: @Eric Cousineau
